summary: This is a grand jury subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to Natividad Ruperez, commanding their appearance on August 16, 2019, to testify and produce documents in an investigation into alleged violations of federal sex trafficking and conspiracy statutes. The document includes an advice of rights and a request to keep the subpoena confidential.

persons.name: Natividad Ruperez
persons.context: The individual commanded to appear before the grand jury on August 16, 2019, to testify and produce documents related to an investigation into alleged federal crimes.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.context: The United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York who signed and issued the grand jury subpoena and the accompanying request for confidentiality.

connections.description: Berman, as the U.S. Attorney, is issuing a legal command (subpoena) to Ruperez to appear as a witness before a grand jury.

events.title: Scheduled Grand Jury Appearance
events.description: Natividad Ruperez is commanded to appear before the grand jury at the U.S. Courthouse in Foley Square, New York, to testify and produce documents.

events.title: Issuance of Grand Jury Subpoena
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office issues a subpoena to Natividad Ruperez as part of an ongoing federal grand jury investigation.

locations: United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, Room 220, Borough of Manhattan, City of New York, New York
The Silvio J. Mollo Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: A grand jury subpoena was issued to Natividad Ruperez in July 2019, compelling testimony and document production for an appearance on August 16, 2019.

The investigation concerns alleged violations of federal statutes including 18 U.S.C. §§ 1591 (sex trafficking), 2421-2423 (transportation for prostitution/illegal sexual activity), and 371 (conspiracy).
The U.S. Attorney's Office requested that Ruperez voluntarily keep the existence of the subpoena confidential to preserve the investigation's integrity.
The document includes a formal 'Advice of Rights' informing the recipient of their right against self-incrimination and right to counsel.
